input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Full moon has a direct effect on sprinkler and weather. Weather has a direct effect on ground. Sprinkler has a direct effect on ground. The overall probability of full moon is 43%. The probability of no full moon and wet ground is 18%. The probability of full moon and wet ground is 16%. Is the chance of wet ground smaller when observing full moon?
